intro: Delphinium wellbyi var. albiflorum, commonly known as the White-flowered Wellby's Larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems that bear clusters of showy, white to pale blue flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, basal leaves that are typically hairy and have a somewhat succulent texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
